Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2008 09:30AM sissy217 wrote: Bridget,  You are amazing- I wish I had your spirit.  Good for you- keep it up!  Lisa
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2008 09:25AM sissy217 wrote: Hi, I am so glad I found this site.  I have a port- I love my port (if you can love any of this!) they do not have to stick me and fight with my veins each time and they can be hard- so it is worth the discomfort of having it put in and I made friends with mine.  I decided as it was healing that I wanted to embrace it and take care of it because it would make this easier.  My port is fine- I have had 3 of 6 treatments now- last one was last Wed. Half-way!! The symptoms do build up.  Does anyone get extremely emotional a day or two after treatment?  I hit quite an emotional low this week-end- felt yucky, low energy and depressed.  I could not stop crying.  I am better now- it has been 4 full days since treatment and I feel better. But the tiredness is getting worse.  If I remember to pace myself, I do okay. It's okay for us to rest now, to comtemplate and to delegate. My children are 18 and 20- I feel for you all with young cheldren, but I also see them assuch a life force for you- to keep you going.  My job keeps me going, my son's search for college and this crazy election- nice distraction. I feel for everyone out there so much- I wish I could hug you all and be together for a time.  Be strong- visualize good times to come, the spring, the future...time will pass for all of us, I know it will. Lisa
